items.title: Inside the Last Old-School Seltzer Shop in New York
items.abstract: Brooklyn Seltzer Boys has a century-old carbonator and a museum with a spritzing station. Beat that, LaCroix.

items.title: Shift to Electric Cars Gives Design Centers a New Look, Too
items.abstract: Automakers are pouring money into research and development facilities, creating spaces intended for creativity and collaboration among design and engineering teams.

items.title: How a Texas Border City Is Shaping the Future of Global Trade
items.abstract: Laredo, across from Mexico on the Rio Grande, is primed to become one of the worldâ€™s most important land ports as American companies reduce their reliance on factories in Asia.

items.title: Ansonia, Conn.: A Small City With a Sense of History
items.abstract: This former manufacturing center in New Haven County is gaining popularity with New Yorkers, thanks to its relative affordability and access to Metro-North.

items.title: New York City Council Initiates Steps to Ban the Manufacture of K2
items.abstract: Seeking to curb a public health crisis, the city proposed three bills that would ban the manufacturing of K2, also known as Spice and synthetic marijuana, and punish business owners for selling the drug.
